messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I am unsubscribing II
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry if this list isn t your cup of tea. This last few days it hasn t been most people s cup of tea I ll warrant. But if you re unsubscribing you need to
messages.messageBody:
Sorry if this list isn't your cup of tea. This last few days it hasn't been
most people's cup of tea I'll warrant.

But if you're unsubscribing you need to follow the directions at the bottom
of each email not send it to the list:

> To unsubscribe from this group, click on the following link or address an
> email to:
> Unschooling-dotcom-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com

Joyce

messages.subject: I am unsubscribing II
messages.msgSnippet: I joined this email group because I thought perhaps I could glean some knowledge from those who have a more child lead approach to EDUCATION.  My email box has
messages.messageBody:
I joined this email group because I thought perhaps I could glean some
knowledge from those who have a more child lead approach to EDUCATION. My
email box has been littered with hundreds of emails (most of no value) that
have assualted my faith and have suggested that I abandon my responsibility
to "TRAIN UP MY CHILD IN THE WAY HE SHOULD GO SO THAT WHEN HE IS OLD HE WILL
NOT DEPART FROM IT" (Bible verse) I am suggesting that all Christians run
from this loop as fast as you can and go spend the time you would have wasted
sifting thru this garbage can loop to perhaps find a useful philosophicial
morsel and spend it eating at a buffet of wisdom in the company of the
CREATOR of the universe. Its an investment of time with greater rewards
And the serendipity... you won't over tax your DELETE button. This loop
gives unschoolers a bad name. Now am I referring to the fundamentalist
unschoolers, southern unschoolers, unschoolers in
general.?.................hmmmmm God bless all and I wish you a speedy
recovery.

lisa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
